["On tap - Refers to something that's available without delay, like water from a tap.", 'Abundant - Indicates an ample supply or plentiful availability.', 'Easily obtainable - Describes items or services that can be acquired without much effort.', 'Accessible - Refers to things within easy reach both physically and in terms of accessibility.', 'Obtainable on demand - Suggests something is available as soon as requested, like a product with next-day delivery.', 'At-hand - Literally means right here; figuratively implies immediate availability or proximity.', "Handy - Something that's convenient and within easy reach or use.", 'Quickly available - Suggests fast access to something, almost instantaneously.', 'Immediate - Indicates no delay between a request and fulfillment.', "Convenient - Something that is suitable for one's comfort or purpose with little effort.", 'Readily accessible - Easy to get to, use, or understand; very available.', 'Within reach - Either literally close enough to touch or figuratively possible and able to be done without great difficulty.', 'Available at short notice - Refers to something that can be provided with minimal time between requesting it and receiving it.', 'Up-to-the-minute - Information, products, etc., are the most current or recent available.', 'Promptly available - Something is accessible quickly without delay.', 'Quick-fetching - Implies rapid acquisition of something; not commonly used but contextually appropriate for crosswords.', 'Straightforward to obtain - Simply and easily acquired, with no complications or barriers.', 'Instantaneously accessible - Refers to immediate and direct availability without any wait time.']
